title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string, which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format, should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a "DateTime" type report parameter in BIRT report designer and entering an invalid date string in the "default value" field, such as "55/66/9999", the date value is not being validated and stored correctly.
EB: The date value should be validated by either the UI or the Model to ensure that only valid date/time strings are accepted and stored correctly.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:

1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type "DateTime".
3. In the "default value" field, enter an invalid date string, such as "55/66/9999".
4. Save the report design.
5. Verify that the invalid date value is not rejected and is stored incorrectly.
